description: From the character Caspar Milquetoast of the comic strip The Timid Soul, created by American cartoonist Harold Tucker Webster (1885–1952) and first published in 1924; the character was named after the American dish milk toast (“a food consisting of toasted bread in warm milk”).

adjectives.description: milquetoast (comparative more milquetoast, superlative most milquetoast)

entries.meaning: (originally US, informal, derogatory) Meek, timid; lacking character or effectiveness.
(originally US, informal, derogatory) A person of meek or timid disposition; a person who lacks character or effectiveness.
examples: Synonyms: softy, wimp, wuss; see also Thesaurus:milksop
